page.title: 18EVENTS IN HAMBLEDON
page.content: {HAMBLEDON HUNT} In the 18th century the area was hunted by two gentlemen who kept private packs of hounds. In 1800 the Hunt Club was formed by Thomas Butler of Bury Lodge; and the pack kennelled at Hook Vinney Farm. The Hunt continued under various masters until the last war when the hounds were boarded out with the North Cornwall. In 1945 they went to the Hunt Kennels at Ropley, but after several moves are now boarded at Droxford, and forty one and a half couple hounds are kept. In 1978 the Hursley Hounds having no master, amalgamated with the Hambledon Hunt. The new hunt meets twice a week, on Wednesday and Saturday and more days if requested by farmers. The places of meeting are the Denmead, Wickham, Langrish triangle and the Hurley area.
